It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a unique and recognizable appearance. Its reproductive structures, known as gemmae, are produced in specialized leaf-like structures called gemma cups. Cyrtoceras reflexum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
